et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}mater{/it}, from {it}mat{/it}, noun, checkmate, ultimately from Arabic {it}māt{/it} (in {it}shāh māt{/it})

dt: {bc}an assistant to a more skilled worker {bc}{sx|helper||}
often used as a familiar form of address
{bc}a deck officer on a merchant ship ranking below the captain
{bc}either member of a couple and especially a married couple
{bc}either member of a breeding pair of animals

et: Middle English, probably from Middle Low German {it}māt{/it}; akin to Old English {it}gemetta{/it} guest at one's table, {it}mete{/it} food {ma}{mat|meat|}{/ma}
shortdef: an assistant to a more skilled worker : helper
friend, buddy —often used as a familiar form of address
to join or fit together : couple

dt: {bc}a tealike beverage drunk especially in South America
{bc}a South American shrub or tree ({it}Ilex paraguariensis{/it}) of the holly family whose leaves and shoots are used in making maté

et: French & American Spanish; French {it}maté{/it}, from American Spanish {it}mate{/it} maté, vessel for drinking it, from Quechua {it}mati{/it} vessel
shortdef: a tealike beverage drunk especially in South America
a South American shrub or tree (Ilex paraguariensis) of the holly family whose leaves and shoots are used in making maté; also : these leaves and shoots

dt: {bc}a navy petty officer specializing in meteorology

et: {it}aerographer{/it} "warrant officer charged with observing weather," from {it}aerography{/it} "meteorology" (from {et_link|aero-|aer-} + {et_link|-graphy|-graphy}) + {et_link|-er:2|-er:2}
shortdef: a navy petty officer specializing in meteorology

dt: {bc}one who is of about the same age as another

shortdef: one who is of about the same age as another

dt: {bc}a person who shares a prison cell with another prisoner

dt.t: When his {wi}cellmates{/wi} learned that his bond had been set at $1 million (and bail at $500,000), they broke into laughter and shook their heads in disbelief.
Within a week, guards came by at night and told me to get ready. … I said goodbye to my {wi}cellmates{/wi} and gathered my things …

shortdef: a person who shares a prison cell with another prisoner

dt: {bc}a horse entered in a race to set the pace for a horse of the same owner or stable
{bc}a candidate running for a subordinate place on a ticket

shortdef: a horse entered in a race to set the pace for a horse of the same owner or stable
a candidate running for a subordinate place on a ticket; especially : the candidate for vice president

dt: {bc}a person who is perfectly suited to another in temperament
{bc}a person who strongly resembles another in attitudes or beliefs

shortdef: a person who is perfectly suited to another in temperament
a person who strongly resembles another in attitudes or beliefs
